back_cards.definition_en: A way in which something is done or happens
back_cards.example_en: She spoke in a confident manner during the meeting.
His good manners impressed the dinner guests.

back_cards.definition_en: A style or method of doing something
back_cards.example_en: The manner of teaching in this school is very interactive.
The cat approached the stranger in a cautious manner.
They discussed all manner of topics at the conference.

back_cards.definition_en: Feeling or showing mild shock or astonishment
back_cards.example_en: She was surprised by the unexpected gift.

back_cards.definition_en: Caught off guard by an event
back_cards.example_en: He looked surprised when the team won the match.
I was surprised at how quiet the forest was.
They were surprised to hear about the new policy.
The teacher was surprised by the student's quick progress.

back_cards.definition_en: A proportion or share in relation to a whole
back_cards.example_en: A high percentage of students passed the exam.

back_cards.definition_en: A rate or proportion per hundred
back_cards.example_en: The sales tax is a percentage of the total cost.

back_cards.definition_en: A portion of something expressed numerically
back_cards.example_en: What percentage of the budget is for marketing?
The percentage of rainy days this month was low.

back_cards.definition_en: A share of profits or earnings
back_cards.example_en: She earns a percentage of each sale she makes.

back_cards.definition_en: Very large in size or amount
back_cards.example_en: The massive building dominated the city skyline.
The concert drew a massive crowd.
The company faced a massive financial loss.
A massive rock blocked the hiking trail.
The team put in a massive effort to win.

back_cards.definition_en: A visible mass of water droplets in the sky
back_cards.example_en: The cloud covered the sun, making it cooler.
A cloud of doubt hung over the decision.
She saved her photos to the cloud.

back_cards.definition_en: A group or swarm of objects
back_cards.example_en: A cloud of birds flew across the field.
A cloud of dust rose from the dry road.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who achieves victory in a competition
back_cards.example_en: She was the winner of the race.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who succeeds in an endeavor
back_cards.example_en: His innovative idea made him a winner in business.

back_cards.definition_en: A highly successful or popular item
back_cards.example_en: This book is a real winner with young readers.

back_cards.definition_en: A person admired for their achievement
back_cards.example_en: The community celebrated her as a winner.
The new policy was a winner for small farmers.
He gave an honest answer to the question.
She runs an honest business with fair prices.
His honest actions earned him respect.
I appreciate your honest opinion on the matter.
The meal was an honest, home-cooked dish.

back_cards.definition_en: To suggest a plan or idea
back_cards.example_en: She proposed a new strategy for the project.
He proposed to his partner at sunset.
The team proposed changes to the schedule.

back_cards.definition_en: To nominate someone for a role
back_cards.example_en: They proposed her as the new team leader.
I propose to finish this task by tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To depend on someone or something
back_cards.example_en: I rely on my phone for daily reminders.
She relies on her friend for honest advice.
The team relies on volunteers to succeed.
We rely on data to make predictions.
The plant relies on sunlight to grow.
The meal costs ten dollars plus tax.
Her skills plus her enthusiasm make her a great leader.
The job offers a good salary plus bonuses.
I bought a shirt plus a pair of shoes.
The trip takes two hours plus traffic delays.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of words expressing a complete thought
back_cards.example_en: She wrote a clear sentence in her essay.

back_cards.definition_en: A punishment given by a court
back_cards.example_en: The judge issued a fair sentence for the crime.
His sentence about the weather sparked a debate.
The teacher corrected the sentence structure.

back_cards.definition_en: A verbal expression of an idea
back_cards.example_en: The speaker ended with a powerful sentence.

back_cards.definition_en: An act of asking for something
back_cards.example_en: She made a request for more time to finish.
His request for funding was approved.
The guest's request for towels was met quickly.
I sent a request for details about the event.

back_cards.definition_en: A call for action or service
back_cards.example_en: The manager handled the client's request promptly.

back_cards.definition_en: The way someone or something looks
back_cards.example_en: Her appearance at the party was stunning.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of showing up or arriving
back_cards.example_en: His sudden appearance surprised everyone.
The house has a tidy appearance.
The band made an appearance at the festival.
Don’t judge by appearance alone.
She called regarding the job opening.
We discussed issues regarding safety.
He had questions regarding the contract.
The email was regarding the meeting time.
The report regarding sales was detailed.
The restaurant served excellent food.
She did an excellent job on the project.
His excellent skills won the match.
The garden looks excellent this spring.
This is an excellent choice for beginners.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who has committed a crime
back_cards.example_en: The criminal was caught after the robbery.
The police tracked the criminal’s movements.
The criminal faced trial for fraud.

back_cards.definition_en: An offender in a legal context
back_cards.example_en: The criminal pleaded guilty in court.
The city aimed to rehabilitate criminals.

back_cards.definition_en: A white crystalline substance used for seasoning
back_cards.example_en: She added salt to the soup.
The experiment involved a type of salt.
His humor was the salt of the conversation.
They used salt to cure the meat.
The mine produced tons of salt yearly.

back_cards.definition_en: The quality of being physically attractive
back_cards.example_en: Her beauty caught everyone’s attention.
The beauty of the sunset was breathtaking.
The beauty of her kindness shone through.
He found beauty in the music’s melody.
This painting is a real beauty.
She filled the bottle with water.
He bought a bottle of wine for dinner.
The recipe called for a bottle of oil.

back_cards.definition_en: A container for cosmetics or medicine
back_cards.example_en: The bottle of lotion was nearly empty.
She didn’t have the bottle to speak up.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of a larger system or machine
back_cards.example_en: The engine is a key component of the car.

back_cards.definition_en: An element of a software program
back_cards.example_en: This component improves the app’s speed.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of a complex structure
back_cards.example_en: Trust is a vital component of any relationship.
Sugar is a component of this cake recipe.
Planning is an essential component of success.
The lawyer charged a high fee for consultation.

back_cards.definition_en: A charge for access or membership
back_cards.example_en: The gym fee includes classes.

back_cards.definition_en: A cost for an application or license
back_cards.example_en: She paid a fee for her visa.
The park has a small entry fee.
Late returns incur a fee at the library.
She wore sparkling jewelry to the party.

back_cards.definition_en: Precious items like necklaces or rings
back_cards.example_en: The store sold handmade jewelry.
Her jewelry matched her dress perfectly.
The museum displayed ancient jewelry.
The jewelry was a gift from her mother.
Is this book yours or mine?
The choice is yours to make.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to something associated with you
back_cards.example_en: Yours was the best presentation today.
I look forward to yours.
This seat is yours for the event.
The clothes were dry after an hour.
The desert has a dry climate.
His dry humor made everyone laugh.
She prefers dry wine with dinner.
The lecture was dry and hard to follow.
